powerwalk.tasks

Class TravelTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • powerwalk.tasks.Task
      • powerwalk.tasks.StepTask
        • powerwalk.tasks.TravelTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Task>

    public class TravelTask
extends StepTask
    This Task travels to the given destination using all available methods.

      • TravelTask

        public TravelTask(Point destination,
          int priority)
        Creates a new TravelTask set to travel to the specified Point
        Parameters:
        destination - the point this TravelTask travels to
        priority - the priority of this Task

      • TravelTask

        public TravelTask(Point destination)
        Creates a new TravelTask set to travel to the specified Point.

        The Task will be made with priority 0.

        Parameters:
        destination - the point this TravelTask travels to

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Calculates a path and checks preconditions for this TravelTask. The Task is immediately canceled when getDestination() == null, or when the PathFinder class has found no path to the given destination.
        Overrides:
        start in class StepTask

      • step

        public void step()
        Attempts to move to the next Point in the path, or waits if no action is required.

        When the Player has more then 20 stamina left, but the Player's run mode is set to false, Run mode is automatically enabled.

        Specified by:
        step in class StepTask

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Reports to the console that the destination has been reached.
        Overrides:
        finish in class StepTask

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the path counter so that the Task can be run again.

        Re-running a TravelTask calculates a path from the current location to the destination, regardless of the previous path. After this method is called, the start() method must be called first to recalculate the path. Note that the PowerWalk Task Manager does this automatically, so when re-assigning this Task to the TaskQueue using the assignTask method from the PowerWalk Bot class or assigning it to a TaskRunner, manually calling the start() method is not required.

        Overrides:
        reset in class Task

      • getDestination

        public Point getDestination()
        returns the destination that this TravelTask is set to travel to.
        Returns:
        the destination of this TravelTask
